message.content:
First we extract the necessary numbers from the three statements and then compute the ratios.

1. Debt to Asset Ratio  
   • From the balance sheet, Total Assets = 14,930,535.06 and Total Liabilities can be obtained by subtracting Owner’s Equity from Total Liabilities and Owner’s Equity. Here, Owner's Equity is 13,963,263.19 so  
  Total Liabilities = 14,930,535.06 – 13,963,263.19 = 967,271.87  
   • Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets  
  = 967,271.87 / 14,930,535.06 ≈ 0.0648  
  Rounded to two decimals, that is ≈ 0.06

2. Gross Profit Margin  
   • From the income statement, Gross Profit = 1,713,437.82 and Total Revenue = 3,025,437.82  
   • Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
  = (1,713,437.82 / 3,025,437.82) × 100% ≈ 56.60%

3. Operating Cash Flow Ratio  
   • From the cash flow statement, Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = 116,257.19 and Total Current Liabilities (from the balance sheet) = 967,271.87  
   • Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Total Current Liabilities  
  = 116,257.19 / 967,271.87 ≈ 0.1202  
  Rounded to two decimals, that equals 0.12

We now present the answer in the required JSON format.

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.06",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "56.60%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "0.12"
  }
}
